page.title: 05 MY LOCAL PAPER
page.content: The name of my local paper is "Y Barcud." "The Barcud" is published monthly,and it costs 25p.It is all written in Welsh, and this month it contains 18 pages - that is September 1985.On the front page there is a picture of our school, and all the pupils.Our teachers are Mr Jones,the headmaster,Mrs Rose and Mrs Williams.The reason why we are on the front page is because we won the Alun R.Edwards shield for 1985.This shield is presented annually to the primary school in the county of Dyfed which contributes most culturally to its area and helps preserve the Welsh language and customs.We help the elderly,collect for the needy,and hold concerts.The elderly are invited into school on St.David's day(March 1st)to enjoy "Cawl a Chan"(traditional Welsh Broth,followed by singing and reciting
